conclusion: Radar emits radio waves, each emission lasts 1 μs, interval between emissions is 100 μs.
Graph shows time intervals between emitted and reflected signals, segments ab and bc are equal.
Total time for round trip of signal is 2 × ab, which equals 100 μs.
One-way travel time is half of round trip time, t = 50 μs.
Distance d calculated using formula d = c × t, resulting in d = 15,000 m.
Final answer: Distance between obstacle and radar is 15,000 m or 15 km.
